alert.note: Alert for Tangipahoa (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 6:25PM CDT until March 30 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN TANGIPAHOA AND WESTERN WASHINGTON PARISHES... At 624 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wilmer, or 10 miles west of Franklinton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Franklinton, Amite, Amite City, Roseland, Mount Herman and Wilmer. This includes Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 42 and 47. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
